role_description: Senior executive overseeing global privacy strategies, risk management, and regulatory compliance.
Leads the privacy team, defining policies, frameworks, and organizational privacy initiatives.
Ensures compliance with privacy laws (e.g., DPDPA, GDPR, CCPA), manages Data Protection Impact Assessments (DPIAs), and acts as a liaison with regulators.
Develops and implements privacy programs, ensuring the organization meets compliance and operational goals.
Manages day-to-day privacy operations, working with legal, IT, and security teams to enforce privacy policies.
Ensures regulatory compliance across jurisdictions, conducts audits, and manages compliance risks.
Oversees all compliance initiatives, aligning the organization with global regulatory frameworks.
Conducts privacy assessments, evaluates data handling practices, and monitors regulatory developments.
Works with product and IT teams to integrate privacy-by-design principles into systems and applications.
Advises the organization on best practices for data protection and regulatory compliance.
Manages data classification, data retention policies, and governance frameworks.
Analyzes compliance gaps, audits processes, and ensures adherence to privacy laws.
Focuses on implementing privacy-enhancing technologies (PETs) and controls to safeguard personal data.
Oversees data retention policies and ensures compliance with legal retention periods.
Identifies privacy risks and ensures risk mitigation strategies are in place.
Conducts internal audits on privacy policies, data flows, and organizational compliance.
Provides legal guidance on privacy laws, contract negotiations, and regulatory compliance.
Monitors privacy laws, engages with regulators, and ensures proactive compliance strategies.
Develops training programs for employees on privacy best practices.
Manages consumer rights requests, such as access, deletion, and correction of personal data.
